# Connecting with Opal data server
## Login to server and assign study data
```{r, echo=FALSE}
#Load R libraries
library(opal)
library(data.table)
library(tidyverse)
library(epiDisplay)
# Create an opal object with the login information
erasmus_opal <- opal.login()
#Login to Opal server and assign the content of the LUCAS table(s) to your RStudio environment
opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'HUNT1_data', 'HUNT.HUNT1',variables = list('AlcFL2W_NT1BLQ2','SmoCigDy_NT1BLQ2','SmoDyCu_NT1BLQ2','SmoCigDyN_NT1BLQ2','SmoDyAg_NT1BLQ2','SmoCigDyCesTm_NT1BLQ2','SmoDyDuEd_NT1BLQ2','ExeF_NT1BLQ2','SmoStat_NT1BLQ2','SmoCigarDy_NT1BLQ2','SmoPipeDy_NT1BLQ2','SmoCigDyPre_NT1BLQ2','SmoCigDy_NT1BLQ2','SmoPackYrs_NT1BLQ2'))
HUNT1 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'HUNT1_data')

opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'HUNT2_data', 'HUNT.HUNT2', variables = list('AlcNev_NT2BLQ1','AlcLiL2WN_NT2BLQ1','AlcWiL2WN_NT2BLQ1','AlcBeL2WN_NT2BLQ1','SmoDyAg_NT2BLQ1','SmoCigDyNEd_NT2BLQ1','SmoCigDyN_NT2BLQ1','SmoDyNev_NT2BLQ1','DriTeaNDy_NT2BLQ1','DriCofBoilNDy_NT2BLQ1','DriCofOtNDy_NT2BLQ1','SmoStat_NT2BLQ1','SmoDyDuEd_NT2BLQ1','InvAg_NT2BLQ1','SmoDyCesDu_NT2BLQ1','SmoPackYrs_NT2BLQ1','SmoPackYrs_NT2BLQ1'))
HUNT2 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'HUNT2_data')

opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'HUNT3_data', 'HUNT.HUNT3',variables=list('AlcBeL2WN_NT3BLQ1','AlcFLY_NT3BLQ1','AlcL4W_NT3BLQ1','AlcWiL2WN_NT3BLQ1','AlcLiL2WN_NT3BLQ1','AlcMor5GlF_NT3BLQ1','SmoNev_NT3BLQ1','SmoCigMyN_NT3BLQ1','SmoCigDyN_NT3BLQ1','SmoCigDyNEd_NT3BLQ1','SmoCigOc_NT3BLQ1','SmoCigarPipeDy_NT3BLQ1','SmoPre_NT3BLQ1','SmoCigarPipeOc_NT3BLQ1','SmoCigDy_NT3BLQ1','SmoNev_NT3BLQ1','ActSporL6M_NT3BLQ2','ExeF_NT3BLQ1','ExeInt_NT3BLQ1','FoVegF_NT3BLQ1','FoFruF_NT3BLQ1','DriWatGl_NT3BLQ1','DriCofEvnN_NT3BLQ1','DriCofOtNDy_NT3BLQ1','DriCofBoilNDy_NT3BLQ1','AlcLiL2WN_NT3BLQ1','SmoStat_NT3BLQ1','SmoDyAg_NT3BLQ1','SmoOcAg_NT3BLQ1','SmoDyDuEd_NT2BLQ1','SmoDyDuEd_NT3BLQ1','PartAg_NT3BLQ1','SmoDyCesDu_NT3BLQ1','SmoPackYrs_NT3BLQ1','SmoPackYrs_NT3BLQ1'))
HUNT3 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'HUNT3_data')

```
## Assign participant id as first column of your harmonized dataframes
```{r, echo=FALSE}
lsb_HUNT_0 <- data.frame(id = HUNT1$id)
lsb_HUNT_1<- data.frame(id= HUNT2$id)
lsb_HUNT_2<- data.frame(id= HUNT3$id)
```
## When you are done with your work, logout of Opal server
```{r, echo=FALSE}
opal.logout(erasmus_opal) 
```

# Alcohol consumption subdomain

### **Variable label**:  Current consumption of alcohol  
**Variable name**: lsb_alc_cur_0  
**Variable description**:  Indicator of whether the participant currently consumes alcohol or has consumed alcohol in the past 12 months.  
**Value type**: integer  
**Variable unit**: N/A  
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------  
0 |  Does not currently consume alcohol   
1 |  Currently consumes alcohol  

**Harmonization status**:  complete  
**Harmonization comment**:   How often did you drink alcohol (beer, wine or spirits) during the LAST 14 DAYS?  
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
lsb_HUNT_0$lsb_alc_cur_0<- recode(as.integer(HUNT1$AlcFL2W_NT1BLQ2),'1'=1L,'2'=1L,'3'=1L,'4'=1L,'5'=0L)

```

### **Variable label**:   Ever consumption of alcohol  
**Variable name**: lsb_alc_ever_0    
**Variable description**:  Indicator of whether the participant has ever consumed alcohol.  
**Value type**: integer  
**Variable unit**: N/A  
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------  
0 |   Never consumed alcohol  
1 |   Ever consumed alcohol  

**Harmonization status**:  complete  
**Harmonization comment**:   The harmonized variable "Ever consumption of alcohol" was created using "Ever consumption of alcohol" from baseline and previous waves and current consumption of alcohol at followup waves. To create this variable, all HUNT data tables were merged by ID in order to facilitate the harmonization work and intermediate variables were created.   
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
#Merging the raw tables LASA1B-LASA1H
MyMerge <- function(x,y){
  df <- merge(x,y, by="id",all=TRUE)
  return(df)
}
#Reducing the table to the variables needed
table_hunt_all <- Reduce(MyMerge, list(HUNT1,HUNT2,HUNT3))

#hrmonization scripts
table_hunt_all$lsb_alc_ever_0<- recode(as.integer(table_hunt_all$AlcFL2W_NT1BLQ2),'1'=1L,'2'=1L,'3'=1L,'4'=1L,'5'=0L)
#merging to harmonized table
lsb_HUNT_0<- merge(lsb_HUNT_0,table_hunt_all[,c("id","lsb_alc_ever_0")],by="id",all.x=TRUE)
```

### **Variable label**:   Ever consumption of alcohol  
**Variable name**: lsb_alc_ever_2    
**Variable description**:  Indicator of whether the participant has ever consumed alcohol.  
**Value type**: integer  
**Variable unit**: N/A  
**Category coding**:  

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------  
0 |   Never consumed alcohol  
1 |   Ever consumed alcohol  

**Harmonization status**:  complete  
**Harmonization comment**:   Study-specific variable:"About how often in the last 12 months did you drink alcohol? (Do not include low-alcohol beer)". The harmonized variable "Ever consumption of alcohol" was created using "Ever consumption of alcohol" from baseline and previous waves and current consumption of alcohol at followup waves. To create this variable, all HUNT data tables were merged by ID in order to facilitate the harmonization work and intermediate variables were created.      
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
#hrmonization scripts
table_hunt_all$lsb_alc_ever_2<- ifelse(table_hunt_all$lsb_alc_ever_0==0 & as.integer(table_hunt_all$AlcFLY_NT3BLQ1)=='8',0L,
                                ifelse(table_hunt_all$lsb_alc_ever_0==1 | 
                                (as.integer(table_hunt_all$AlcFLY_NT3BLQ1)>='1' & as.integer(table_hunt_all$AlcFLY_NT3BLQ1)<=7),1L,NA))
#merging to harmonized table
lsb_HUNT_2<- merge(lsb_HUNT_2,table_hunt_all[,c("id","lsb_alc_ever_2")],by="id",all.x=TRUE)
```

# Tobacco consumption subdomain

### **Variable label**:  Current tobacco smoking  
**Variable name**:  lsb_smk_cur_0  
**Variable description**:  Indicator of whether the participant currently smokes any tobacco product.  
**Value type**:  integer

0 |   Never smoked tobacco  
1 |   Ever smoked tobacco  

**Harmonization status**:  complete  
**Harmonization comment**:   Missing or NO (value 0) recoded to YES if reported time since smoking cessation AND/OR answered questions about smoking status in HUNT2 and/or HUNT3 which corresponds to smoking cessation before HUNT1. NO or YES were recoded to MISSING if answered YES to smoking cigarettes daily AND without time since smoking cessation AND answered questions about smoking status in HUNT2 and/or HUNT3 which corresponds to still smoking daily or smoking cessation after participating in HUNT1.  
All all HUNT data tables were merged by ID in order to facilitate the harmonization work and intermediate variables were created.  
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
#hrmonization scripts
table_hunt_all$lsb_smk_ever_0<- recode(as.integer(table_hunt_all$SmoStat_NT1BLQ2),'0'=0L,'1'=1L,'2'=1L)
#merging to harmonized table
lsb_HUNT_0<- merge(lsb_HUNT_0,table_hunt_all[,c("id","lsb_smk_ever_0")],by="id",all.x=TRUE)
```  
### **Variable label**:  Ever tobacco smoking  
**Variable name**:  lsb_smk_ever_1    
**Variable description**:  Indicator of whether the participant has ever smoked any tobacco product.

**Code** | **Category Label**  
------------- | -------------

**Harmonization status**:  complete  
**Harmonization comment**:   For followup waves, the harmonized variable was created using "Ever tobacco smoking" from baseline and previous waves and current tobacco use at followup waves. To create this variable, all HUNT data tables were merged by ID in order to facilitate the harmonization work and intermediate variables were created.  
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
#hrmonization scripts
table_hunt_all$lsb_smk_ever_1<- ifelse(table_hunt_all$lsb_smk_ever_0==0 & as.integer(table_hunt_all$SmoStat_NT2BLQ1)==0,0L,
                                  ifelse(table_hunt_all$lsb_smk_ever_0==1 | 
                                  (as.integer(table_hunt_all$SmoStat_NT2BLQ1)>=1 &   
                                  as.integer(table_hunt_all$SmoStat_NT2BLQ1)<=2),1L,NA))
#merging to harmonized table
lsb_HUNT_1<- merge(lsb_HUNT_1,table_hunt_all[,c("id","lsb_smk_ever_1")],by="id",all.x=TRUE)
```

**Category coding**:  

**Harmonization status**:  complete  
**Harmonization comment**:   A corrected variable from the original variable SmoCigDyN from HUNT2. IF SmoStat_NT1BLQ2 =1 (ex-smoker) AND SmoStat_NT2BLQ1 =1 (ex-smoker) AND (Diff: SmoCigDyN_NT2BLQ1 - SmoCigDyN_NT1BLQ2 < 0). Then SmoCigDyNEd_NT2BLQ1 = SmoCigDyN_NT1BLQ2.

**Variable unit**:  cigarettes/day  
**Category coding**:  

**Harmonization status**:  complete  
**Harmonization comment**:   A corrected variable from the original variable SmoCigDyN from HUNT3. IF SmoStat_NT2BLQ1 =1 (ex-smoker) AND SmoStat_NT3BLQ1 =1 (ex-smoker) AND (Diff: SmoCigDyN_NT3BLQ1 - SmoCigDyNEd_NT2BLQ1 < 0).  Then SmoCigDyNEd_NT3BLQ1 = SmoCigDyNEd_NT2BLQ1, Missing=SmoCigMyN/30 IF SmoCigMyN>15 AND Smostat=3 (daily smoker) OR SmoStat=1 (Ex-smoker) AND answered on the variablesSmoDyAg and SmoDyCesAg.  
Was recoded to 0 when the participant responded no to "current tobacco smoking".  
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}

```

**Variable name**:  lsb_smk_start_0    
**Variable description**:  Age at which the participant started smoking any tobacco product.  
**Value type**:  integer  
**Variable unit**:  years  
**Category coding**:  

**Harmonization status**:  complete  
**Harmonization comment**:  How old were you when you started smoking daily? {If ever smoked daily:}
Some misunderstandings, instead of age some have reported Year or number of years since event. 
Inconsistencies are checked, and if possible corrected based on probability and reported age in HUNT2 and HUNT3. Recoded to missing if age of starting smoking > current age or age < 7 yrs.
MISSING was set equal to age of starting smoking from HUNT2 IF age of starting smoking from HUNT2 was approximately equal to age of starting smoking from HUNT3 and before participation age in HUNT1.
